record_data.record_plain_text:
TrueLight Energy, LLC FERC Electric Tariff, Volume No. 1
1. Availability: TrueLight Energy, LLC ("TLE") makes electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services available under this FERC electric tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. 2. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and TLE. 3. Seller Category: TLE is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a), in all regions. 4. Compliance with Commission Regulations: TLE shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning TLE's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes TLE to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits TLE's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning TLE's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 5. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: TLE has received waiver of: Subparts B and C of Part 35, except for sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; Part 41, Part 101, and Part 141, except sections 141.14 and 141.15; and received blanket approval under Part 34. (TrueLight Energy, LLC, Docket No. ER11-[ ] ([ ], 2011)) 6. Ancillary Services: (a) PJM: TLE offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. (b) New York: TLE offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. (c) New England: TLE offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England Inc. (d) California: TLE offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. (e) Midwest ISO: TLE offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midwest Independent Transmission System Operator, Inc. ("Midwest ISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to Midwest ISO. (f) Third-Party Ancillary Services: TLE offers Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers. 7. Effective Date: This tariff is effective as of the date accepted by (or such other date specified by) the Commission.
